medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant pain, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days prior to admission, with right upper quadrant pain starting 2 hours after eating dinner. The pain was originally noted to be intense but had reduced by the time of examination. The patient experienced 4 episodes of vomiting, with the last episode appearing red. He reported having 3 similar episodes of nausea, vomiting, and right upper quadrant pain in the past, which resolved within 5 hours.
medical_history.past_medical_history: High blood pressure, high cholesterol, Type II Diabetes (diet controlled), bilateral cataracts, trauma-related surgery of the right finger.
medical_history.family_history: Denies history of colorectal cancers, heart disease, hypercholesterolemia.
